TopicTitle: Rosetta and the final count down :)

Articles.Content: Just over an hour to go until Rosetta begins her maneuver to orbit 67P. Wow :) Isn't science just great?

Watching with you now. Hope all goes well. LIVE COVERAGE:

http://rosetta.esa.int/
And of course no tv channel cares about this

It is really a shame, that this mission doesn't get at least some media or tv coverage.

I am following the mission since 2004. And this is really a master piece of remote controlled space technology.

I am looking forward to mid november, when the lander makes contact to the comet.

Surely I would give a months income to attend the landing in Colonge control center, where the DLR does the microgravity landing maneuvers.

It is really a shame, that this mission doesn't get at least some media or tv coverage.

I am following the mission since 2004. And this is really a master piece of remote controlled space technology.

I am looking forward to mid november, when the lander makes contact to the comet.

Surely I would give a months income to attend the landing in Colonge control center, where the DLR does the microgravity landing maneuvers.

We have to remember that almost nobody cares about space exploration. Society is so dumbed down that most people only care about their closest surroundings and social networks.
Orbit (if you can call it that) now confirmed Sweet

We already have a thread on this. No need to spam around.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/79190-Rosetta-Philae-and-Comet-67P-Churyumov-Gerasimenko
